basics.name: Shreni Singh
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: I’m Shreni, originally from India, and currently pursuing my MS in Computer Science at Boston University. Before diving into grad school, I worked as a Software Engineer at DXC Technology, where I gained experience in C# development and managing large-scale databases. I’m passionate about applied machine learning, data science, and software development, with a focus on optimizing applications and algorithms. When I’m not working on academic projects or development, I enjoy exploring AI, mobile apps, and emerging tech.

work.name: DXC Technology
work.summary: Developed, tested, and debugged code for software applications in C#. Managed large-scale databases and resolved numerous issues related to legacy .NET applications.
highlights: Developed and tested 5+ software development applications in C#.
Maintained a 3+ million record database ensuring optimal performance and data accuracy.
Resolved 3,650+ issues related to .NET legacy applications over two years.

work.name: Questrom School of Business, Boston University
work.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant - Unsupervised Machine Learning
work.summary: Coordinated and assisted with the preparation of assignments, projects, and tracking student performance for a class of 100+ students.
highlights: Collaborated with professors to ensure timely delivery of course materials.
Maintained detailed records of student performance.

work.name: HelpNow (Pentanami Technologies Pvt. Ltd.)
work.summary: Developed healthcare mobile applications for patients and doctors, optimized data retrieval and user interface performance.
highlights: Developed and deployed a healthcare app with 100+ downloads.
Fetched data from GraphQL and displayed it efficiently in the app.

work.name: Innodatatics
work.summary: Developed a real-time prediction web app for sample collection time, utilizing machine learning models.
highlights: Developed a Random Forest model and compared with other models to optimize results.
Collected and created realistic dummy data from primary and secondary sources.

projects.name: MuseAI
projects.description: AI-driven platform for exploring the intersection of AI and music.
highlights: Classifies music into genres and moods.
Generates lyrics and chord progressions based on situational prompts.

projects.name: Florist - Flower Selling Ecommerce Mobile App
projects.description: An intuitive mobile app for purchasing flowers and arrangements.
highlights: Features secure payments and real-time delivery tracking.
Developed with user-friendly interface for easy navigation.

projects.name: Predicting Closed Questions on Stack Overflow
projects.description: AI-driven system to predict whether a Stack Overflow question will be closed and the reason for closure.
highlights: Developed using Python, BERT, and Deep Neural Networks.
